TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit SoapMessage extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents the data in a SOAP request or SOAP response at a specific .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The primary use of the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessage> class is for SOAP extensions, representing the data in a SOAP request or SOAP response. When the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapExtension.ProcessMessage%2A> method is called, a <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapExtension> receives a <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessage> at each <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage>. It is up to the particular SOAP extension to choose how to process the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessage>. Common SOAP extensions include encryption and compression.
SOAP extensions can be applied to either or both an XML Web service method created using ASP.NET or an XML Web service client. When a SOAP extension is applied to an XML Web service method, the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapExtension.ProcessMessage%2A> method receives an instance of <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapServerMessage>, which derives from <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessage>. Likewise, when a SOAP extension is applied to an XML Web service client, <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapExtension.ProcessMessage%2A> receives an instance of <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapClientMessage>.
## Examples [!code-cpp[SoapMessage#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/SoapMessage/CPP/SoapMessage.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[SoapMessage#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/SoapMessage/CS/soapmessage.cs#1)] [!code-vb[SoapMessage#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/SoapMessage/VB/soapmessage.vb#1)]

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets the SOAPAction HTTP request header field for the SOAP request or SOAP response.
Docs.value: The SOAPAction HTTP request header field for the SOAP request or SOAP response.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessage.Action%2A> property can be accessed during any <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage>.
## Examples [!code-cpp[SoapMessage#2](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/SoapMessage/CPP/SoapMessage.cpp#2)] [!code-csharp[SoapMessage#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/SoapMessage/CS/soapmessage.cs#2)] [!code-vb[SoapMessage#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/SoapMessage/VB/soapmessage.vb#2)]

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ ContentEncoding { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.ContentEncoding : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the contents of the HTTP header.
Docs.value: The contents of the HTTP header.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A SOAP extension can set the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessage.ContentEncoding%2A> property to provide supplementary information about the encoding of a SOAP message without changing the media type as expressed in the `Content-Type` HTTP header.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ ContentType { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.ContentType : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the HTTP of the SOAP request or SOAP response.
Docs.value: The HTTP of the SOAP request or SOAP response. The default is "text/xml".

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessage.ContentType%2A> property can only be accessed in the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage.BeforeSerialize> and <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage.BeforeDeserialize> stages; otherwise, an <xref:System.InvalidOperationException> is thrown.
Use the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessage.ContentEncoding%2A> property, instead of the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessage.ContentType%2A> property to provide supplementary information about the encoding of a SOAP message.
## Examples [!code-cpp[SoapMessage#3](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/SoapMessage/CPP/SoapMessage.cpp#3)] [!code-csharp[SoapMessage#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/SoapMessage/CS/soapmessage.cs#3)] [!code-vb[SoapMessage#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/SoapMessage/VB/soapmessage.vb#3)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void EnsureInStage() cil managed

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, asserts that the current is a stage where in parameters are available.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The asserted stage is different for XML Web service clients and XML Web service methods. An XML Web service method's in parameters are available after the SOAP request is deserialized in the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage.AfterDeserialize> stage. For an XML Web service client, the in parameters are available prior to the SOAP request serialization process in the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage.BeforeSerialize> stage.
<xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessage.EnsureInStage%2A> can be called during any <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage>, however an <xref:System.InvalidOperationException> is thrown when in parameters are not available.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void EnsureOutStage() cil managed

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, asserts that the current stage is a stage where out parameters are available.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The asserted stage is different for XML Web service clients and XML Web service methods. An XML Web service method's out parameters are available prior to the SOAP response serialization process in the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage.BeforeSerialize> stage. In an XML Web service client, the out parameters are available after the SOAP response deserialization process in the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage.AfterDeserialize> stage.
<xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessage.EnsureOutStage%2A> can be called during any <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage>, however an <xref:System.InvalidOperationException> is thrown when out parameters are not available.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig instance void EnsureStage(valuetype System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage stage) cil managed

Docs.summary: Ensures that the of the call to the XML Web service method is the stage or stages passed in. If the current processing stage is not one of the stages passed in, an exception is thrown.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Multiple stages can be asserted by performing a bitwise OR operation on multiple instances of the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage> class.
<xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessage.EnsureStage%2A> can be called during any <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage>.
## Examples The following example asserts that the current <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage> is either <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage.BeforeSerialize> or <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage.BeforeDeserialize>; if it is not, an exception is thrown.
[!code-cpp[Classic SoapMessage.EnsureStage Example#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Classic SoapMessage.EnsureStage Example/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[Classic SoapMessage.EnsureStage Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Classic SoapMessage.EnsureStage Example/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Classic SoapMessage.EnsureStage Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Classic SoapMessage.EnsureStage Example/VB/source.vb#1)]

Docs.exception: The current is not the asserted stage or stages.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Web::Services::Protocols::SoapException ^ Exception { System::Web::Services::Protocols::SoapException ^ get(); void set(System::Web::Services::Protocols::SoapException ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Gets the from the call to the XML Web service method.
Docs.value: The that occurred in the call to the XML Web service method. if no has occurred during the call to the Web Service method.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessage.Exception%2A> property can be accessed during any <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance object GetInParameterValue(int32 index) cil managed
Public Function GetInParameterValue (index As Integer) As Object

Docs.param: The zero-based index of the parameter in the array of parameters.
Docs.summary: Gets the parameter passed into the XML Web service method at the specified index.
Docs.returns: An representing the parameter at the specified index.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessage.GetInParameterValue%2A> property is only accessible when in parameters are available. ASP.NET throws <xref:System.InvalidOperationException> when accessing the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessage.GetInParameterValue%2A> property if in parameters are not available.
In a <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapClientMessage> the in parameters are available in the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage.BeforeSerialize><xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage>. In a <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapServerMessage> the in parameters are available in the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage.AfterDeserialize><xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage>.
## Examples [!code-cpp[SoapMessage#6](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/SoapMessage/CPP/SoapMessage.cpp#6)] [!code-csharp[SoapMessage#6](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/SoapMessage/CS/soapmessage.cs#6)] [!code-vb[SoapMessage#6](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/SoapMessage/VB/soapmessage.vb#6)]

Docs.exception: The parameter is less than 0 or greater than the length of the parameters array.
Accessing this property when in parameters are not available.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance object GetOutParameterValue(int32 index) cil managed
Public Function GetOutParameterValue (index As Integer) As Object

Docs.param: The zero-based index of the parameter in the array of parameters.
Docs.summary: Gets the out parameter passed into the XML Web service method at the specified index.
Docs.returns: An representing the parameter at the specified index.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If out parameters are not available, ASP.NET throws an <xref:System.InvalidOperationException> when accessing the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessage.GetOutParameterValue%2A> property.
In a <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapClientMessage> the out parameters are available in the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage.AfterDeserialize><xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage>. In a <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapServerMessage> the out parameters are available in the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage.BeforeSerialize> of the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage>.
## Examples [!code-cpp[SoapMessage#8](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/SoapMessage/CPP/SoapMessage.cpp#8)] [!code-csharp[SoapMessage#8](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/SoapMessage/CS/soapmessage.cs#8)] [!code-vb[SoapMessage#8](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/SoapMessage/VB/soapmessage.vb#8)]

Docs.exception: The parameter is greater than the length of the parameters array.
Accessing this property when out parameters are not available.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance object GetReturnValue() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets the return value of an XML Web service method.
Docs.returns: An representing the return value of the XML Web service method.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If a return value is not available, ASP.NET throws <xref:System.InvalidOperationException> when accessing the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessage.GetReturnValue%2A> property.
In a <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapClientMessage> the return value is available when the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage> value is <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage.AfterDeserialize>. In a <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapServerMessage> the return value is available when <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage> value is <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage.BeforeSerialize>.
## Examples [!code-cpp[SoapMessage#9](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/SoapMessage/CPP/SoapMessage.cpp#9)] [!code-csharp[SoapMessage#9](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/SoapMessage/CS/soapmessage.cs#9)] [!code-vb[SoapMessage#9](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/SoapMessage/VB/soapmessage.vb#9)]

Docs.exception:
The XML Web service method does not have a return value.
-or-
The return value is not available.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Headers As SoapHeaderCollection

Docs.summary: A collection of the SOAP headers applied to the current SOAP request or SOAP response.
Docs.value: A of the SOAP headers applied to the current SOAP request or SOAP response. , if there are no SOAP headers.

remarks.format:
## Remarks SOAP headers are an optional portion of a SOAP request or SOAP response. For more details on using SOAP headers in XML Web services created using ASP.NET and their clients, see the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapHeader> class.
Although the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessage.Headers%2A> property can be accessed at any stage, it is only populated with the SOAP header information in the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage.BeforeSerialize> and <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage.AfterDeserialize> stages.

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property MethodInfo As LogicalMethodInfo

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets a representation of the method prototype for the XML Web service method for which the SOAP request is intended.
Docs.value: A representing the XML Web service method for which the SOAP request is intended.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Although <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessage.MethodInfo%2A> can be accessed during any <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage>, it only has data during <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage.AfterDeserialize> and <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage.BeforeSerialize>.
## Examples [!code-cpp[SoapMessage#7](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/SoapMessage/CPP/SoapMessage.cpp#7)] [!code-csharp[SoapMessage#7](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/SoapMessage/CS/soapmessage.cs#7)] [!code-vb[SoapMessage#7](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/SoapMessage/VB/soapmessage.vb#7)]

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating the property of either the or the attribute applied to the XML Web service method.
Docs.value: if the property of the or applied to the XML Web service method is ; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks See the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapDocumentMethodAttribute.OneWay%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property of <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapDocumentMethodAttribute> or <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapRpcMethodAttribute> for details about one-way XML Web service methods.
The <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessage.OneWay%2A> property is accessible in all stages of <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage>.
## Examples [!code-cpp[SoapMessage#4](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/SoapMessage/CPP/SoapMessage.cpp#4)] [!code-csharp[SoapMessage#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/SoapMessage/CS/soapmessage.cs#4)] [!code-vb[SoapMessage#4](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/SoapMessage/VB/soapmessage.vb#4)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable ReadOnly Property SoapVersion As SoapProtocolVersion

Docs.summary: Gets the version of the SOAP protocol used to communicate with the XML Web service.
Docs.value: One of the values. The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks For a <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapServerMessage>, the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapServerMessage.SoapVersion%2A> property is guaranteed to be valid after the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage.BeforeDeserialize> stage. In the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage.BeforeDeserialize> stage the property is available, however the SOAP message has not been completely processed and SOAP extensions that may alter the contents of the SOAP message have not run.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Stage As SoapMessageStage

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessage.Stage%2A> property can be accessed at any <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage>.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to determine the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage> within the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapExtension.ProcessMessage%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> method.
[!code-cpp[Classic SoapExtension.ProcessMessage Example#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Classic SoapExtension.ProcessMessage Example/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[Classic SoapExtension.ProcessMessage Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Classic SoapExtension.ProcessMessage Example/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Classic SoapExtension.ProcessMessage Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Classic SoapExtension.ProcessMessage Example/VB/source.vb#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Stream As Stream
public: property System::IO::Stream ^ Stream { System::IO::Stream ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the data representing the SOAP request or SOAP response in the form of a .
Docs.value: A read-only instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks SOAP extensions that inspect the data representing a SOAP request or SOAP response, such as a logging SOAP extension, can use the `Stream` property to view the data at each <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage>.
SOAP extensions that modify the data representing a SOAP request or SOAP response, such as encryption or compression SOAP extensions, should do so with the <xref:System.IO.Stream> passed into the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapExtension.ChainStream%2A> method of <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapExtension>. The <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessage.Stream%2A> property of <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessage> passed into <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapExtension.ProcessMessage%2A> is read-only.
For more information on modifying the data representing a SOAP request or SOAP response, see <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapExtension.ChainStream%2A>.

Docs.value: The base URL of the XML Web service.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessage.Url%2A> property can be accessed during any <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapMessageStage>.
